tones. 
The eyes of the general and the soldier met. The general became silent, angrily pulling down his tight scarf. 
"I request you to have the goodness to change your coat," he said as he turned away. 
"HE'S COMING!" shouted the signaler at that moment. 
The regimental commander, flushing, ran to his horse, seized the stirrup with trembling hands, threw his body across the saddle, righted himlelf, drew his saber, and with a happy and resolute countenance, opening his mouth awry, prepared to
